1.text: Then Job answered the Lord, and said :

2.text: I know that thou canst do all things, and no thought is hid from thee.

3.text: Who is this that hideth counsel without knowledge? Therefore I have spoken unwisely, and things that above measure exceeded my knowledge.

4.text: Hear, and I will speak : I will ask thee, and do thou tell me.

5.text: With the hearing of the ear, I have heard thee, but now my eye seeth thee.

6.text: Therefore I reprehend myself, and do penance in dust and ashes.

7.text: And after the Lord had spoken these words to Job, he said to Eliphaz the Themanite : My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends, because you have not spoken the thing that is right before my, as my servant Job hath.

8.text: Take unto you therefore seven oxen, and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer for yourselves a holocaust : and my servant Job shall pray for you : his face I will accept, that folly be not imputed to you : for you have not spoken right things before me, as my servant Job hath.

9.text: So Eliphaz the Themanite, and Baldad the Suhite, and Sophar the Naamathite went, and did as the Lord had spoken to them, and the Lord accepted the face of Job.

10.text: The Lord also was turned at the penance of Job, when he prayed for his friends. And the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.

11.text: And all his brethren came to him, and all his sisters, and all that knew him before, and they ate bread with him in his house : and bemoaned him, and comforted him upon all the evil that God had brought upon him. And every man gave him one ewe, and one earring of fold.

12.text: And the Lord blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning. And he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.

13.text: And he had seven sons, and three daughters.

14.text: And he called the names of one Dies, and the name of the second Cassia, and the name of the third Cornustibil.

15.text: And there were not found in all the earth women so beautiful as the daughters of Job : and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

16.text: And Job lived after these things, a hundred and forty years, and he saw his children, and his children’s children, unto the fourth generation,

Psalm 145:4	Generation and generation shall praise thy works: and they shall declare thy power. Psalm 145:5	They shall speak of the magnificence of the glory of thy holiness: and shall tell thy wondrous works. Psalm 145:6	And they shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and shall declare thy greatness. Psalm 145:7	They shall publish the memory of the abundance of thy sweetness: and shall rejoice in thy justice. Psalm 145:8	The Lord is gracious and merciful: patient and plenteous in mercy. Psalm 145:9	The Lord is sweet to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works. Psalm 145:10	Let all thy works, O lord, praise thee: and let thy saints bless thee. Psalm 145:11	They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom: and shall tell of thy power: Psalm 145:12	To make thy might known to the sons of men: and the glory of the magnificence of thy kingdom. Psalm 145:13	Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages: and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations. Psalm 145:14	The Lord lifteth up all that fall: and setteth up all that are cast down. Psalm 145:15	The eyes of all hope in thee, O Lord: and thou givest them meat in due season. Psalm 145:16	Thou openest thy hand, and fillest with blessing every living creature. Psalm 145:17	The Lord is just in all his ways: and holy in all his works. Psalm 145:18	The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him: to all that call upon him in truth. Psalm 145:19	He will do the will of them that fear him: and he will hear their prayer, and save them. Psalm 145:20	The Lord keepeth all them that love him; but all the wicked he will destroy. Psalm 147:15	Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth: his word runneth swiftly. Psalm 147:16	Who giveth snow like wool: scattereth mists like ashes. Psalm 147:17	He sendeth his crystal like morsels: who shall stand before the face of his cold? Psalm 147:18	He shall send out his word, and shall melt them: his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run. Psalm 147:19	Who declareth his word to Jacob: his justices and his judgments to Israel.
